list_definition.definition: a type of detached or semi-detached (usually luxury) house, in the country or suburbs, or used for holidays at the seaside

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: They have a villa at the seaside.

list_ex_of_english: A villa is in many ways an escape from the modern world and the complex compromises of city life.
The task of the villa architect seems to be to reconstitute some sense of the continuity between a building and its setting.
According to this view, towns and a villa system scarcely evolved here.
But he was talking about a street of villas and that's how they read in the street, for sure.
The villa system probably did exist; it simply looked different and is difficult to trace archaeologically.
Their dwellings were principally flats or tenements - upper-class single-family villas are not included.
The paper is at its best when searching for a definition of the villa as a type, and placing it within a historical context.
Staying in the house for a long weekend you tend to drift into the rhythm of the day that a villa reveals to us all.
